learning_outcomes.description: Articulate the foundational knowledge in the area of entrepreneurship
Develop, evaluate and communicate actionable business opportunities as part of a startup team
Create viable and innovative Business Models
Critically analyse knowledge creation in the startup process
Practice real-time entrepreneurial leadership to craft ideas & test impacts

assessments.task_description:
The presentation arc covers three rounds for a new venture idea that you will develop in your teams: a facilitated pitch delivered in real-time to your peers (deliver in week 4), a video articulating your venture growth strategy (upload in week 8) and an autopsy appraising your reflection on the opportunity and the conditions where it might grow in the future (upload in week 12).

Each team presents 3 times - pitch, video & autopsy - each student moderates each presentation of 3 other teams, as allocated by RiPPLE

Each team round will be moderated by peers while the quality of your moderations will be marked across each presentation.

In addition, you will each assess the members of your team in completing each round to generate a peer assessment factor that will then be applied to your team score to yield an individual score for each presentation.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Each presentation across pitch, video & autopsy to be uploaded to Blackboard as well as creating a team resource in RiPPLE for each.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
Generate a resource using the entrepreneurial theory thta aligns with the case topic. Your peers will moderate your topic exploration shown in the resource you produce.

Create 1 resource, moderate 3 others for each of 4 topics.

Each topic requires the creation of 1 resource and the moderation of 3 other resources.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Use the RiPPLE link provided in Blackboard>Assessment for each case topic
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.due_date:
End of Semester Exam Period

2/11/2024 - 16/11/2024

Complete 3 questions once case is released
assessments.task_description:
A case study assignment that builds on your online resource/moderations sets to apply your analystical thinking skills. The case study provides a range of resources and allows access to online and text resources during the period from release to due date. The case study is to be individually undertaken, without reference to other students in the class or any commercial resources other than provided, in the spirit of demonstrating your own entrepreneurial growth strategy-building skills.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit on Blackboard link provided via Turnitin
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
S1 | New Ventures

Introduce entrepreneurship, a history of entrepreneurial thought and its place in today's economy. Opportunity discovery & creation. Projects to develop. Assessment timelines. Student team formation.
- Difference between small firms, entrepreneurial ventures and larger
corporations
- Entrepreneurial teams

Learning outcomes: L01
learning_activities.topic_description: S1 | New Ventures Introduce entrepreneurship, a history of entrepreneurial thought and its place in today's economy. Opportunity discovery & creation. Projects to develop. Assessment timelines. Student team formation. - Difference between small firms, entrepreneurial ventures and larger corporations - Entrepreneurial teams

learning_activities.topic:
S2 | Discovery-driven Planning

Developing assumptions to bring new products & services to market. Crafting an idea canvas. Exploring a DDP case.


Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: S2 | Discovery-driven Planning Developing assumptions to bring new products & services to market. Crafting an idea canvas. Exploring a DDP case.

learning_activities.topic:
S3 | Business Models

Shaping business models and exposing underlying growth drivers of value. Building a business model canvas. Dissecting business models to distil growth pathways


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: S3 | Business Models Shaping business models and exposing underlying growth drivers of value. Building a business model canvas. Dissecting business models to distil growth pathways

learning_activities.topic:
S4 | Present growth pitch

Deliver class presentation in your teams, showing how business model enables growth
learning_activities.topic_description: S4 | Present growth pitch Deliver class presentation in your teams, showing how business model enables growth

learning_activities.topic:
S5 | Entrepreneurial Strategy

Entrepreneurial strategy frameworks: forming opportunity to gain competitive advantage & growth. Framing topics of inquiry.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: S5 | Entrepreneurial Strategy Entrepreneurial strategy frameworks: forming opportunity to gain competitive advantage & growth. Framing topics of inquiry.

learning_activities.topic:
S6 | Lean Startup Appriaches

Tools to interpret key attributes of proposed or existing firms, to understand underlying value and to frame strategic capability-growth actions
learning_activities.topic_description: S6 | Lean Startup Appriaches Tools to interpret key attributes of proposed or existing firms, to understand underlying value and to frame strategic capability-growth actions

learning_activities.topic:
S7 | Business Building

Strategies for new ventures using discovery-driven growth; to leverage into expanded operations & new markets

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: S7 | Business Building Strategies for new ventures using discovery-driven growth; to leverage into expanded operations & new markets

learning_activities.topic:
S8 | Entrepreneurial Analyses

Customer discovery & validation. Building experiments to frame a problem and test a solution then apply to team projects. Interpret how lean approaches can unlock growth opportunities

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: S8 | Entrepreneurial Analyses Customer discovery & validation. Building experiments to frame a problem and test a solution then apply to team projects. Interpret how lean approaches can unlock growth opportunities

learning_activities.topic:
S9 | Disruptive Innovation

Exploring hypergrowth using chasm theory as a mechanism to predict technological dispersion so to pre-empt destructive growth forces
learning_activities.topic_description: S9 | Disruptive Innovation Exploring hypergrowth using chasm theory as a mechanism to predict technological dispersion so to pre-empt destructive growth forces

learning_activities.topic:
In-semester break

Conduct further validation of your business ventures in your teams
learning_activities.topic_description: In-semester break Conduct further validation of your business ventures in your teams

learning_activities.topic:
S10 | Entrepreneurial Hypergrowth

Exploring NPV and reverse financials as tools to interpret growth assumptions to accommodate uncertainty in finance models. Apply finance models to prospective ventures to interpret capital needs & long-term value potential
learning_activities.topic_description: S10 | Entrepreneurial Hypergrowth Exploring NPV and reverse financials as tools to interpret growth assumptions to accommodate uncertainty in finance models. Apply finance models to prospective ventures to interpret capital needs & long-term value potential

learning_activities.topic:
S11 | Leadership & Emergent Growth

How technological & business model innovations can exploit asymmetric forces, for startups to displace resource-rich incumbents, or yield incremental improvements in product or service deliveries. Examine how innovations disrupt incumbents by crafting new market dynamics for 'good enough' products & services that substitute or complement current offerings

Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: S11 | Leadership & Emergent Growth How technological & business model innovations can exploit asymmetric forces, for startups to displace resource-rich incumbents, or yield incremental improvements in product or service deliveries. Examine how innovations disrupt incumbents by crafting new market dynamics for 'good enough' products & services that substitute or complement current offerings

learning_activities.topic:
S12 | Entrepreneurial Finance

Drivers for design-led growth strategies and how to organise for emergent growth paths in entrepreneurial ventures. Organising new venture using 2 different frameworks with distinct philosophies

Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: S12 | Entrepreneurial Finance Drivers for design-led growth strategies and how to organise for emergent growth paths in entrepreneurial ventures. Organising new venture using 2 different frameworks with distinct philosophies

learning_activities.topic:
S13 | Navigating Uncertainty

Review key components of entrepreneurship theory & practice, pursuing opportunities beyond resources to hand. Reflecting on the journey through the course, discuss the team autopsy & preparing for the final case study assignment released & due during examination period.
learning_activities.topic_description: S13 | Navigating Uncertainty Review key components of entrepreneurship theory & practice, pursuing opportunities beyond resources to hand. Reflecting on the journey through the course, discuss the team autopsy & preparing for the final case study assignment released & due during examination period.
